description: A collection of the building blocks of polymers.  With this and a whole lot of know-how, you can create proteins and other building blocks of life.
For the mixing of biomaterials that might otherwise be antithetical to one another.
Lab-grown or bioprinted muscle fibers; much denser and with higher performance ratios than baseline human muscles.
Materials capable of taking environmental chemicals and utilizing them for self-repair; be careful you don't make gray goo.
Uncontaminated pure cellular matter that, with the right instructions, can become just about anything.
